descriptionSet.description: A group of six soldiers from different regions of the British Empire pose for the title image of the imperial calendar 1901. All of them armed with rifles, they stand / kneel in front of a large British flag. The bottom part of the central image holds the portrait of a young British woman wearing a pearl necklace.

inscription.text: Stevenson & Howell Ltd. Manufacturers of Soluble Essences, Fruit Essences, Essential Oils, Colours, &c.
To Aerated Water Makers. use Stevenson and Howell's red Ball Brand of pure Soluble Essences, Fruit Essences, Colours, &c.
Pure Essential Oils of Lemon Selected, Orange, Limes, &c. &c.

Soluble Essences Of Jamaica Ginger. Perfect Lemon. Stone Ginger Beer. Orange Champagne Tonic. Kola Champagne. Cinchona Tonic. Cherry Cider. Belfast Ginger Ale. Lemon Squash. Raspberry Champagne Pick-Me-Up. Pineapple, &c., &c.
Raspberry Fruit Extract. Strawberry Cream Flavor. Liquid Red, Lemon, Orange, &c., &c. Will stand all Climates and Conditions.
Representative in Bengal, Assam & North-West Provinces: Geo. Knowles, 1, Hare Street, Calcutta.
Stock held by Butto Kristo Pal & Co., 7, Bonfields Lane, [...]lcutta.

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

rights.text: Copyrighted. Copyright with the original artists and publishers.

titleSet.title: Defenders of the Flag, Imperial Calender 1901, advertisement of Stevenson & Howell Ltd. manufacturers of soluble essences
